description: The proseminar introduces MLA students to a range of key issues for urban environments in the anthropocene epoch and their implications for practice and research in landscape architecture. The focus is on developing critical perspectives that come from a deeper understanding of landscape architectural knowledge, methods, and speculation. Classes consist of a series of roundtables by landscape architecture faculty members and/or guest speakers followed by a discussion of assigned readings and a discourse on research questions, specific skills, and applicability in practice.
title: Proseminar in Landscape Architecture
